Reviews.Title: “Great for a family event”
Reviews.Author: PKPSU
Reviews.Content: Nice hotel and the staff were great. We organized a family "meet" with relatives coming from all over the country. The organized dinner (with their sales staff) ended up being out of our ballpark for pricing but the stay and the service in the lodging aspects of this property were very nice. Starbucks coffee in the lobby in the AM was a nice touch. The rooms were clean, well outfitted and the general purpose area was really nice. I would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “I enjoyed my stay”
Reviews.Author: fedacct
Reviews.Content: The room was clean, in decent shape, and relatively upscale. Not sure what the complaints are about regarding a need to update the rooms. The front desk allowed me an early check-in and a late departure. The breakfast buffet was above average but not outstanding. It was expensive but to be expected for a hotel of this caliber. Service was good although it did take us a long time to get our bill. A bit surprised that a hotel of this caliber still has smoking rooms these days. Consequently, I was unable to get a king non-smoking. I got an excellent rate. This is a good option if you have activities on the north side of Indy or can't get a room downtown. It was nice that the hotel was very close to both Castleton and Keystone Malls.

Reviews.Title: “Hilton North Indy”
Reviews.Author: scootiequeen
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hilton on Christmas night. Everyone was very friendly, especially the gal at the front desk (Kate?) The handicapped rooms were great--roll-in showers and plenty of room. It looked like they had just upgraded the rooms, but the hallways were still a bit dingy--clean, but old looking. We booked 3 rooms for the whole family and everyone said that the beds were very comfortable. Coffee in the rooms and in the lobby. Lobby was very nice. Restaurant was expensive, even for breakfast. Had a little store off to the side. Wish they would sell bagels or muffins. Booked with priceline and got a great deal. Will be back.

Reviews.Title: “Nothing Outstanding”
Reviews.Author: hsipes
Reviews.Content: The room was clean...which was wonderful. The hotel is older and needs an update to the rooms. They charge too much per night not to have renovated.

Reviews.Title: “Donna W”
Reviews.Author: Donna W
Reviews.Content: The Hilton Hotel North did a phenomenal job hosting our annual women conference. The customer service was bar far the best I have ever experienced in any hotel. Kudos to Eddie, Jason and the entire Hilton staff for making our event a great success.

Reviews.Title: “Great for business travel”
Reviews.Author: SeptSav
Reviews.Content: The rooms are not huge but it's comfortable, clean and convenient to shopping or whatever else you want to do. Great mattress for a good nights sleep. Great place for a conference. Food is always good that is provided.

Reviews.Title: “OK Hotel, not what I expect from Hilton”
Reviews.Author: Charles M
Reviews.Content: There is really nothing wrong with this hotel that couldn't be fixed by changing the name to one of dozens of more ordinary chains. We've grown to expect a bit more from Hilton, though, in terms of just a little better quality than average. But that's it here, just average. Average size rooms, average bathroom, nothing special in the way of decor or amenities, average staff, perhaps not even quite average breakfast buffet. But the location is good for many of the things we like around Indy -- Castleton and Keystone malls, Carmel, even downtown is not hard to get to.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel in a north side location.”
Reviews.Author: mirandabader
Reviews.Content: This hotel was not huge, but rather just the right size. The staff was friendly, the rooms were clean and nice, and the pool was warm. I wish the hotel had a hot tub and I wish they weren't so far off the main road, but I was satisfied with our stay. I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel, Would Stay There Again”
Reviews.Author: Dawn Y
Reviews.Content: My friend and I were attending a conference in downtown Indy and although we would have loved to stay downtown, that was out of our budget. I was able to get a room for one night through priceline.com for $50 and was very pleased with the room and the price. The lobby was nice, clean and pleasant smelling. The staff was very courteous and friendly. Check in and out was quick and easy, thanks to prepaying through priceline.com. Room was clean and comfortable. The bed was amazingly comfy and there were 4 nice, fluffy feather pillows on each one. I had read some reviews that said the hotel was older and it was obvious - worn carpet and such - but they must have recently replaced the carpet because it looked and smelled new. The bathroom was clean and nicely stocked with delicious-smelling soap and shampoo and plenty of towels. We were on the 4th floor and there were no loud parties or kids running around or noisy events going on such as a wedding reception. I was able to hear noise in the hall when a few people walked by talking, but it was not distracting. The only things I didn't care for or wasn't impressed by were the absence of an exhaust fan in the bathroom, which made getting ready after taking a shower like trying to get ready in a sauna HOT AND STEAMY. The coffee in the room claimed to be "Italy's Favorite"...if that's the case, Italians know nothing about coffee...it was really terrible! Fortunately, they brew Starbucks in the lobby and there is a Starbucks just down the street. It would have been nice to have a small refrigerator in the room as well. Over all, I was very happy with this hotel. I have stayed at a Ramada somewhere around Indy that we paid more for but had a terrible, old smell and was rather dumpy. I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel and nice people”
Reviews.Author: cgempler
Reviews.Content: We stayed there for a wedding. The hotel was very clean and the staff was very pleasant and accommodating. One night about 15 family members took over part of the lobby for an impromptu party at 10:30 pm and the staff was helpful to get us seating. Just a real friendly place to stay. Only con is no continental breakfast but they do have a bar and restaurant in the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Restaurant Service Poor”
Reviews.Author: NTXTravel
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at this hotel 3-4 times in the past year. The rooms are fine (pretty standard Hilton) but the restaurant and meal service is poor. First of all, the only breakfast choice is a buffet, so if you aren't a big eater, it is a waste of money. Second, with a waitstaff whose only job is to deliver coffee and checks, you would expect very prompt service. In fact, you can wait a long time for coffee (no self-service available) and a very long time to get your check. I have also been to this hotel for meetings, and the food was OK, but delivered late. Feels like one person must be cooking and cleaning and delivering food. In addition, the parking situation is pretty bad--very crowded in front of hotel. There is a side lot but it's not clear where hotel guests are permitted to park.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice Hilton”
Reviews.Author: yeah_11
Reviews.Content: I came to Indianapolis in July '10 for the Brickyard 400 and got a great price for this hilton on hotels.com. Upon arriving, the staff was very helpful. The rooms were very spacious, extremley clean and the beds were surprisingly very comfortable. The only downside is that there wasn't a very large selection of resturants in the surrounding area, but aside from that I would definatley consider this hotel again the next time I'm in Indy for a race.

Reviews.Title: “Prime location, ease of access and outstanding service”
Reviews.Author: WBLaker1979
Reviews.Content: At first, I was not going to consider this Hilton given the less than stellar reviews. However, since it was my first trip in Indianapolis and I wanted to be near the business I was working with, I thought it'd be worth a try. After my stay on April 4th, I must say it was as a pleasant experience as I've had at a Hilton. For full disclosure, I've been a Hilton Diamond member for over 15 years and can speak unequivocally about them. The upgrade I requested at check-in was honored by providing me with free internet access and an oversized King suite on the 3rd floor (room 336). Everything was in order; no calls to housekeeping for towels, toiletries, or an unkept room. While it looks like it hadn't been remodeled in 5 to 10 years, there was evidence of age due to wore out carpet or furniture. In general, it was quite comfortable. Next came room service and Cassie, who brought up the Reuben sandwich and salad in just under 5 minutes! She was friendly and professional, consistent with Mark at the front desk. I'd requested a room upgrade in a quiet location since I needed to get up early. I enjoyed a perfect night's sleep, as I heard no adjacent noises or hallway shenanigans. As to location, I was able to go to a Fedex Kinkos and a Chase bank within 1 miles or less of the hotel, and my business meeting was at the Castleton Mall which was about 2 miles away. All in all, I could not have selected a better hotel at a more prime location for my purposes. I will return there in two weeks and look forward to my experience and see if it will measure up. My guess is that it will.

Reviews.Title: “clean, but....”
Reviews.Author: xtalguy_11
Reviews.Content: The Hilton facilities were clean and quite and our Priceline bid of half a C note/night made this a good deal. The pool renovations were unfortunate, but the lack of a complementary newspaper and pay per view wifi seemed more unreasonable.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Stay”
Reviews.Author: ibujawa
Reviews.Content: It was a nice stay, the hotel is kind of an old property. The staff was friendly, the room is clean, though the bathroom need a little bit cleaning. Free parking but no free WiFi internet :(

Reviews.Title: “2nd stay here... and will return again!”
Reviews.Author: suzieq50
Reviews.Content: We came back to this hotel for the second time with a wonderful "Priceline" bid. We were very happy with our stay. The property was full on both nights we were there and we found everything to be wonderful. We will stay here again if the opportunity arises!

Reviews.Title: “Met Expectations and Then Some”
Reviews.Author: JohnroFlorida
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel last weekend. Excellent rate at $59 a night. For that rate, it exceeded all of my expectations and then some. Nice size room with LCD TV - Bathroom was nice but on the small side. Hotel staff was pleasant and was helpful in making sure I could stay in same room since I had made a separate reservation for each night. Hilton Gold Member and received my extra points and free internet with no issues. Some of the other hotels will throw in a few additional extras but at the rate I paid for this hotel I feel I was treated fairly. Only area lacking was the restaurant. I saw the waiter one time - when she seated me and then when she came by to give me my bill. Fortunately, I was able to flag down the other waiter and he would come by the table and check on me from time to time. Breakfast was good but for the price it seemed limited compared to the selection at other Hilton Hotels. If coming again to Indy I would probably try to stay closer to Downtown but if the price is right I would have no hesitation about coming here again.

Reviews.Title: “very frustrating....”
Reviews.Author: ajkjb
Reviews.Content: My daughter chose this hotel for her wedding party & family members to stay at on Oct. 1st & 2nd 2010. They have a nice lobby and cozy appearance. (Serious check in issues). We made reservations in July 2010 & confirmed in August 2010, then confirmed again Sept. 29th as we wanted no "surprises" We got there & one of my son's "had no room"....Well, finally they managed to get him a room, but it was on 4th floor & the rest of our famiy was on 6th floor. (we were told we would all be on the same floor). Then I gave them my credit card and told them that I had 2 more son's coming the next day and to put those rooms on "this same credit card". The desk clerk said OK. When my one son got there, he tried to get checked in & receive his room keys & they told him he would have to give them "a credit card" or he couldn't have his room. (He couldn't get ahold of me by phone at that time, so he ended up driving 4 hours back home, (as he doesn't have a credit card.) We were "told" that my mother in law's room would be "adjoining our room" as she has health issues & needs "checked on" and that "didn't happen either. Then "beware" of the rude blonde in the restaurant as she is "clueless" on what customer service is. I stepped into the restaurant and asked her for an order of Biscuits and gravy to go (as my daughter was upstairs getting ready for her wedding) and she says "YOU CAN JUST ORDER ROOM SERVICE" ....So I said well, I would like to just get it now and take it to her, would that be OK. So, I paid her and she comes back 20 MINUTES later w/ my order. And the place had only 3 people eating. Anyway, the bartender was nice... Oh, and you have to "request" a microwave / & or refrigerator as they are not "automatically in the rooms"...We requested those items also (weeks ago) and didn't get those either. (So, if you like to be "FRUSTRATED" then stay here).

Reviews.Title: “Hilton was nice”
Reviews.Author: AngelaMBrooks
Reviews.Content: The hotel was very clean - the bathroom is a must to be clean and it was. I do not usually walk in rooms with no shoes on and I did. The only complaint I had was they had two towels and three wash clothes. I had to ask for more towels daily - which they provided with no problem but with two people staying in a room - two towels are not enough. Other than that - it was a very clean hotel - the rooms are nice - the bathrooms are smaller than I expected. Internet cost $9.95 for 24 hours - I was shocked!! Glad I had my phone to connect to my lap top

Reviews.Title: “Great location, great service!”
Reviews.Author: cjsclark
Reviews.Content: We have been staying at this hotel yearly for our annual trip to the MotoGP races. My husband usually blocks a large amounts of rooms for a group he belongs to and the event planning staff does a great job with this. The rooms are clean, the beds are comfortable and the bar does a good job handling loud biker guys at 11 PM :-). The buffet breakfast is good in the AM as well. This hotel is a large hotel but it's easy to navigate with no waiting for elevators. The location is great and by numerous good eating establishments. The nicest touch is that if you have a bike you can park under the awning which is extra security. We will continue staying at this hotel for our yearly trip!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect place to stay!”
Reviews.Author: suzieq50
Reviews.Content: My DH and I stayed here for 1 night to assist our son with his move to the area. We "pricelined" a room and were thrilled with the results! We thought the location was great. The property was clean and well kept. Our room overlooked the airconditioners - who cares - we were only sleeping and showering there! I would definitely recommend this property. Staff very courteous.

Reviews.Title: “Should let guests know about conferences”
Reviews.Author: ChicagoBauer
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the hotel during a Furry convention. There were hundreds of people running around in animal costumes. The nature of the conference didn't bother us; however, the convention guests seemed to completely overrun the hotel, were oblivious that others were staying there and the hotel staff did not do anything about it. For example, there were several organized meetings held in the lobby - if you were in the hotel bar, it was very distracting. In addition, the costumed characters were very aggressive in how they approached guests - coming up and trying to give people hugs. Several times we had to actively avoid being approached. It was very disconcerting and had we known about the event, we would have stayed elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, slightly above expectations.”
Reviews.Author: mlsrar
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for one night with family. Property was fully booked with two weddings and a conference at the nearby hospital. Rooms were exceptionally clean for what appeared to be an older property. Beds were comfortable, but there was some ambient noise that drifted from the wedding's DJ (by ambient, I mean a strong bass-line that was inevitably going to permeate the premises) Toilet would not flush but engineering was quick to respond, given the busy nature of the place. As in most Hilton-propers, no free WiFi unless you're a HHDiamond. Pool was nice and clean, along with ample parking. H

Reviews.Title: “Party till 1100pm then play in the hall way till mid”
Reviews.Author: watertraveler4
Reviews.Content: I was on the 2nd floor and my bed was shaking. From the band down stairs. Try calling the front desk. No answer tried 3 times called room service to try to talk to someone. They answered said I will get manager to call you! NO that didnt happen. I called the 1800 hilton number they patched me thru to the manager. Said he cant do anything. They had the room till 11pm. This started at 9pm. We had to get up at 5am and go compete in a USA meet. They didnt care. 3 calls to the 1800 number later and 1115 the band quit. But then the party moved to the hallways till Mid. Still no answer at the front desk. Must of been with the party???? If you need to get rest ,thats not going to happen at this hotel on Shadeland Ave. Good Luck on piece and quiet. As far as compensation well they are working on that it will probably take 6-8 weeks. Oh lets not forget if your a priceline (third party customer) You dont get any consideration according to the manager. If you stay for cheap or get treated like cheap. Except the people that clean the rooms were very nice and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: mjwingfans
Reviews.Content: We stayed here on our way to Missouri for a family wedding. Got a good deal online. It was a very nice hotel. Easy to find, located near the highway. The room was nice, spacious for our family of 5. My kids loved the indoor pool. The breakfast buffet was really good- it's not complimentary, but it was reasonably priced. I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “First Hilton Experience....”
Reviews.Author: Mac_Maximum
Reviews.Content: Unlike most reviews for this hotel on here, this is real not fake. The property is older, but it is clean. The Good... 1. The Lobby was pretty open and wide. 2. It has an internal restaurant 3. Pool and Exercise Room were clean. 4. Starbucks Coffee is brewed here. 5. Saved a ton of cash by using Priceline.com, I named my own price. Hell yes. I would be ticked if I paid full price. The Say Whaaat? 1. The hotel has breakfast services in the morning...Omelettes cost over 16 bucks. Holy crap batman! 2. The Bathrooms DO NOT have Fan Ventilation! Hot damnnation, I have to towel off in the bedroom, because the bathroom is like the amazon?!? 3. You cannot see the hotel from I-69, there is a large competitor hotel between the hilton and freeway. The Bad... 1. The hotel has both rooms, Smoking and Non-Smoking 2. The parking lot is not well lit, pretty scary if you were parked far away. (many lights were not working). 3. The trees have sap warning signs, damage could occur if you arrive at the wrong time of year. 4. The cost, a normal night ranges from 130 to 160. Pretty high, the Hilton Garden is a ramp north of this hotel. It may cost the same, the rooms may have Ventilation Fans! 5. There is a Starbucks coffee pot when you check out in the morning, it was empty when I left. So no coffee for me!! If you are not paying for this hotel, then I can recommend it. But if you are paying this, then this place is 50 to 60 bucks too much.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place”
Reviews.Author: Dilbert65
Reviews.Content: We reserved a room at the Hilton through Priceline.com and were extremely satisfied with the accomodations. The place was clean, comfortable and just an overall nice place. The swimming pool was very nice and my children really enjoyed it. As stated in other reviews, the elevators weren't of the best quality, but that certainly didn't spoil our experience. Highly reccomend Hilton Indianapolis North. One thing I would caution travelers on. They have a sign that says something about parking with caution under the trees, because they drip sap. Take that seriously, they do drip. There are plenty of other spaces to park though.

Reviews.Title: “Decent hotel”
Reviews.Author: timmy16
Reviews.Content: Went to this hotel for a concert at the Verizon Center, which is about 15 minutes away. I travel alot and for the price we paid ($90), which is a steal for a Hitlon. Overall the Hotel is clean and the rooms are average and comfortable. A few minor issues : 1) we could hear almost ANY noise the kids in the room next to us made all night. 2) $9.95 for internet, I mean, really? I guess I am just surprise these days when hotels still charge for interent...not that $10 is an issue, its just the point. 3) Elevators are super slow It has a decent location to restaraunts and there was a pretty large mall just a couple minutes away. If you are going to a concert in the area or need to be in the part of town, this hotel is just fine.

Reviews.Title: “Good location for interstate access”
Reviews.Author: letsgo36
Reviews.Content: Stayed here one night because I needed early morning easy access to I69N. This is a great location for that access as well as access to I465 around Indy. Got a super price on Priceline, but I saw why once I got there- they were not busy at all. Large room, quiet (but then they weren't busy, in deference to another reviewer). Clean. Definitely a 3+ star-rating. Not much help, though, no one offered to help with luggage. Had a salad from the restaurant/lounge, pretty pricey, but it was late I didn't want to leave. Hotel is convenient, though, to restaurants. Only complaint: something sticky got sprayed all over my car thru the night. Don't know what it was; took thru car wash & it came off.

Reviews.Title: “Not too bad...”
Reviews.Author: jrnorthport
Reviews.Content: I booked a 4 star, Indianapolis northeast side location on priceline.com. Knowing the four star hotels in the area. My bid was accepted at less that half the website rate. The hotel was what we expected. Which was fine. Didn't dine in the hotel restaurant which was a little pricey compared to the very good local eateries. My only problem was with the hotel parking. The hotel was not full by no means but, they schedule a lot of events in their many event rooms making parking in primises a problem. There were no staff available when checking in or out to help with our bags. We found a luggage cart and did it ourselves.

Reviews.Title: “Average hotel near Fishers”
Reviews.Author: CaitlinK
Reviews.Content: We needed to be in Fishers for work, so this was a good location for us. Being a Hilton Honors Diamond member, I always choose the free breakfast option. However, when I checked in, there was a mistake and the front desk person would not offer me breakfast vouchers. I just accepted the fact, and didn't make a big deal out of it. One thing that bothered me about the layout of the hotel, is that there are no other convenient entrances besides the front entrance. We parked our car in the back, but we'd have to walk all the way around to the front, or enter through the back entrance where the meeting rooms were. Either way, it'd be a lot of walking just to get back to our rooms from the back parking lot. On the second day of our stay, someone(maybe a manager?) called up and asked how the stay is going so far...I mentioned the breakfast voucher mishap, and he said he'd take care of it. When I went downstairs he had vouchers waiting for me. That was very nice, but I really should have gotten them in the first place. The breakfast was good. The hotel is not very near downtown Indy, though. If you need to be in this area for some reason, this is an option.

Reviews.Title: “Serenity Bed Makes Up For Any Other Shortcomings!”
Reviews.Author: orr333
Reviews.Content: I travel to the area frequently and usually stay in Carmel. This trip being last minute found me searching nearby as all Hilton Family properties were booked up in Carmel. Just 6 miles from Carmel, I found this Hilton. I only briefly looked at the past reviews as I had confidence in the Hilton name. I am a HH Diamond member so received my choice of perks upon the very simple and quick check in. The hotel is easy to get in and out of from the I-69 and I-465 freeway system. The room is nicely set up and roomy enough. At first I felt the buibs in the bathroom were way too dim but they were the "slow warming" type which is nice in the morning when you need to adjust to the light. The walls were thinner than any other Hilton I have been in. Door slams and some activity (alarm clock) next door could be heard. I am a heavy sleeper so it had little impact on me. I can say that the plush Serenity Bed more than makes up for any other items lacking at this property! Most of my stays in Carmel are at a Hampton Inn and while the Hampton bed is good, the Hilton bed is SO MUCH better! OTHER NOTABLES: The water pressure was VERY GOOD which is something that I really enjoy! There is a small pool and exercise area which looked quite nice. Parking is easy and seemed to be plentiful enough for the property. I ate the breakfast as my free perk for being Diamond. It was just average with the usual eggs, bacon, sausage, french toast, fruit and cereal but not stellar. Service was good. Overall, this is a nice property and will stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Elegant and Excellent”
Reviews.Author: Ed60062
Reviews.Content: We were there for two nights and found the room to be spacious and in excellent condition. The only issue is that the room was a little musty and the windows cannot be opened. We had the Sunday morning breakfast buffet and it was very well done. Our room was quiet with no noise heard from the hallway or adjacent rooms. Parking is free but they charge for internet service in the room. However, you can use the computers in the business center for free internet access. We didn't use the pool but it appeared large and atrtractive.

Reviews.Title: “Sleep 101 -- Go back to school”
Reviews.Author: dennisfan
Reviews.Content: While the Hilton Indianapolis North is a nice, clean, updated hotel located within a few miles of TONS of great shopping and dining, the hotel fails in what should be its prime objective...SLEEP! My husband and I stayed for a nice, weekend getaway. We booked through Priceline, so I really didn't have a choice for the hotel, but the price we paid was very good. We requested a king room, which they were able to accommodate even though the hotel was completely booked for all kinds of sporting events. There was a college basketball team there, as well as, what seemed to be HUNDREDS of kids for some kind of soccer tournament. Anyway, our room was very satisfactory. It was spacious, clean, and everything seemed to be in working order. No complaints. Then we heard teenagers goofing off in the hall. I thought they'd move on, but they didn't. Pretty soon, I heard music playing outside my door, so I opened the door and went out. There were three teenaged girls just sitting around on the floor outside my room. One licking a sucker, one playing a radio and the other just standing there. I didn't say a word, I just looked at them like, "Why are you guys sitting outside my door?" One of the girls obviously read minds, so she offered, "We're just sitting here waiting for someone in 'that' room." She pointed to the door next door to mine. I just walked back into my room without saying a word, but thankfully, they got the point and moved along. All weekend, there were kids running up and down the hallways. I don't blame the kids or the hotel...this is just irresponsible parenting (there were parents everywhere, too). Anyway, my room was nice enough, other than the obvious, and even with the noise, I was still okay with the hotel...until it was time to go to bed. The bed feels soft and squishy, which at first feels okay, but me AND my husband woke up stiff and achy in the middle of the night! Also, the A.C. doesn't cool well enough. There is scientific PROOF that the ideal sleeping temperature for the human body is 64 degrees F. I can't stand it when hotel A/C units don't function well. If you are the type of person who likes it COLD when you sleep (like me), get ready to sweat. Plus, the bedding was VERY warm, so the room really needed to be much cooler for comfort. My husband doesn't like it as cold as I do, but even he was hot. He completely took the covers off himself. So between the soft mattress, warm down bedding, and the warm room, we were pretty miserable at night. Which is too bad because this could be a great hotel. They need new mattresses and cooler bedding and/or better A/C units. They have a restaurant downstairs that is pretty decent. An indoor pool. The staff were very friendly and helpful. The location is near two Indianapolis shopping malls, and dozens of restaurants. It's also about 30 minutes from a casino off I-69, if you like to gamble. Parking is also FREE which is a huge plus! If I got this place for a great price (like I did), I'd probably be okay with it again, but I would not pay rack rate for this place. No way. Too many other hotels around to be miserable.

Reviews.Title: “Where's the baggage carts?”
Reviews.Author: tahoIndianapolis
Reviews.Content: Couldn't find one until we returned from our event late in the evening. Also, no backup roll of T.P. and the strangest trash cans that were only 5 inches wide! The shuttle bus driver was very accomodating. Great bed!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel for the Money”
Reviews.Author: ChicagoQT
Reviews.Content: We came here for the Indy 500 2009. While other hotels raised their prices during this time, this Hilton was very affordable. The hotel was on the other side of town, but no big deal. Rooms were nice & clean, bed & pillows very comfortable. I didn't notice any "thin walls." Pool was clean, check in was fast & prompt. I would stay here again

Reviews.Title: “Hiltonized”
Reviews.Author: jafpitt
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the Hilton for one nite, prior to flying out of the Ind Int;l airport the next morning. Drive was about 30 min to airport via the 465 beltway. We loved the hotel. The staff took extra effort to ensure our stay was the best it could be. The room was very clean and modern. We had no problem with noise or services. The location was fine for us as we had friends on the North side of downtown and wanted to visit the casino on exit 26 of I-69. The hotel is about 20 min from downtown. Parking is free, but they do charge for internet service. Our priceline bid was $52 and accepted. We feel we got exceptional value for what we paid. Over the past years, I have been staying at a number of Hiltons...I must say, they seem to offer quality service everywhere I stay and hotels are very well maintained.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel with thin walls”
Reviews.Author: steeeeevo
Reviews.Content: Overall, we were happy with the Hilton. Our room was nice and the hotel was in a convenient location for us. I'll start with the big negative and then fill you in on a few of the positives. THIN WALLS! As we were laying in bed winding down for the night, let's just say we heard lots of interesting noises coming from the room next door. Apparently the couple next door was really enjoying their stay, if you know what I mean. I understand that this stuff happens, but the noise and the knocking was uncomfortably loud. We laughed at first, but eventually it just became annoying. So the positives? Pretty much everything else. The staff was friendly, but not overly-so. We booked through Priceline, so the price was good. The pool and exercise room were quite nice. We didn't use any of the conference facilities, so I can't comment on that. I was also annoyed that internet cost $10 a day or something like that. But it was free in the lobby, so that's a plus. I would have rated this 4/5 if not for the neighbors.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hilton”
Reviews.Author: jsarasien
Reviews.Content: Check-in was quick and painless. I was upgraded to an Executive Room by the kind and courteous staff. The room was nicely sized with a comfortable bed. The Executive Lounge had an excellent assortment of food and beverages for both the evening reception and breakfast. This hotel is much nicer than the Downtown Hilton, plus free parking. Highly recommended!!

Reviews.Title: “Nice place”
Reviews.Author: nunuhead
Reviews.Content: Room booked at last minute due to flight cancellation. Nice, large lobby, with pool, looked recently renovated. Rooms were a nice size. Supposedly non-smoking but room had distinct cigarette smell. Disappointed that wireless internet not free - really should be standard for hotel of this class. Hotel restaurant just so-so.

Reviews.Title: “Left me wanting more”
Reviews.Author: Theaxman
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel for one night. The outside and lobby make this seem like a 4 star hotel, but the rooms and service bring it down. Front Desk Service: 3 stars (Friendly, but I checked in online and it took them 5 minutes to figure that out) Decor: Very clean, nice lobby, pool and workout area Restaurant: Hope this isn't normal. There were 5 people in the restaurant on a Sunday night and the waittress acted like I was disturbing her. Food was good Room: Have closets bigger than the bathroom. Room was adequate, but below my expectations for Hilton. Extras: Have a car, there is nothing within walking distance

Reviews.Title: “Nicely refurbished, but few extras”
Reviews.Author: elsh
Reviews.Content: This is the old Omni and it has been recently refurbished. Rooms are a nice size, but unfortunately have double beds instead of queens (even though there is plenty of room for the larger beds). Beds are comfortable and room was clean, except the tile grout in the shower shows mildew stains which could and should be easily cleaned with a good tile cleaning product. Our only real complaint was the lack of free internet access--$10 per day is very steep in this day and age. There is a business center in the lobby, but there is a fee to use that as well. Free wireless is an amenity we have come to expect in all price ranges of hotel rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Young staff but getting better”
Reviews.Author: terravisum
Reviews.Content: The Hilton Indianapolis North is rather far from the center of downtown and located in a more industrial part of the town. That said in a 5 miles radius there are enough shopping malls and restaurants so that you do not feels isolated. The hotel has a modern look from the outside but the internal is a bit more traditional. The lobby and meeting rooms area has been updated and looks nice for a Hilton that is this far from the town. The staff are mostly young folks but seems to enjoy their work. Catherine from the front desk is a pleasing young lady who welcomed me back every time that I have been back. As an HHonors top-tier member, I have been given an upgrade to the Executive level room and access to the lounge on the 6th floor without asking. The king-bed rooms are is an average size for the Hilton of this category. The bed is comfortable with the usual 4 different types of pillows to choose from. An comfy armchair with ottoman, writing desk and TV rounding out the room furniture. Nothing exceptional but nothing in bad shape either. The corner room are a bit more quieter although The bathroom amenities are the usual CrabTree & Evelyn product line. I have always like the Hilton bathroom size better than the Sheratons as they are just a bit larger so I can squeeze in without feeling constraint. Water pressure is good here and the tiles are clean. Room service speed is a bit slow as there are only one person manning the restaurant guess as well as fielding the room service calls. I have to physically come down to the restaurant once to order for my food. The samosas on the menu was not available in the two times that I ordered. The good thing is that I got a call in this respect to change my order. Morning breakfast buffet was OK, the kitchen once messed up my omelet (I did not want any cheese). The service was friendly if not a bit nervous. The executive lounge has some pastry, fruits and cereal in the morning and 2 appetizers (which are changed everyday). Wine and beer are available for a fee. There is a computer with free Internet access and a printer for lounge guests. The cab ride from the IND airport cost around $60 each way but the hotel can arrange a town-car that cost $40 from the hotel to the airport. A free shuttle ride is available for trips in 5 miles radius. This is one of the better Hilton outside of large city center and the price is also decent.

Reviews.Title: “Good, comfortable hotel”
Reviews.Author: domerdan
Reviews.Content: While this Hilton certainly doesn't offer anything special in the way of service or amenities, my room was comfortable and fairly modern and the hotel is in a very convenient location (about 2 minutes from I-69 or I-465). If you are looking for a comfortable room that gets the job done, this is a solid choice.

Reviews.Title: “Just as bad as when it was the Omni...”
Reviews.Author: slicer76
Reviews.Content: When we arrived at the hotel, the front desk told us that we had been upgraded to a 'nicer and bigger room.' We didn't ask for this but they were going to charge us an extra $20. We got up to the executive floor and entered the room. If it is nicer and bigger than what they have in the rest of the hotel then I shutter to think of what the rest of the hotel is like. It is the smallest hotel room we have ever stayed in. Then, my wife found hair all over the bathroom and old cheerios under the desk. The cheerios had been there so long that they were stuck to the carpet. Even the housekeeper that they sent up couldn't believe it. Meanwhile, I tried to get online to waste some time. No dice. To use the high speed wireless internet requires that you pay $9.95 per day for access. This was on top of the extra $20 they were going to charge us for the room. The next morning our bill showed just how cheap the Hilton's have become. We were charged $.75 a piece for LOCAL calls that were made to order take out from down the street. You think you hate Paris now, just wait til you stay at her hotel. We will never stay at a HIlton again.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hilton”
Reviews.Author: Kelly5182
Reviews.Content: This Hilton hotel is a very nice property. It is beautifully decorated, updates and clean. The staff at this hotel were friendly and helpful. The rooms were typical Hilton rooms- furnsished well, clean and comfortable. The indoor pool area was nice also.

Reviews.Title: “A Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: KYTravelGuru
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Hilton North for 2 night this past January Saturday and Sunday night. We stayed in the Presidential Suite room 618 I dont know if I would call it a Presidential Suite, but it was very nice. The Room was very spacious and very clean I will say no porblems there. There was a very nice and very large whirlpool jacuzzi that me and my fiance took some time to explore. Room service was very good!! I would definitly stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Good night at the Hilton North”
Reviews.Author: HannahIndiana
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hilton North last Saturday night. Had no trouble checking in around 2pm even though the hotel looked like it was pretty full. Our room was exceptionally clean and there were 5 pillows on the king-sized bed. The bed itself was very comfortable. The bathroom was a little bit small, but clean and the toiletries were Neutrogena and smelled great. Elevators were very slow. Parking lot was completely full when we returned late in the evening (there is some comstruction going on at the back of the building). They have an AWESOME breakfast buffet--fresh fruit, nice pastry selection, delicious omelet station, good eggs Benedict, etc. The pool area looked nice, too. We would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great package pricing...excellent hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Purchased a trip to Indy for the NASCAR Brickyard 400, thru the Omni Hotels "Air+Hotel+Car" package. The pricing was spectacular, in fact the front desk couldn't believe we got a room for $65 a night, especially on a race weekend. We had all the paperwork to bak it up and they congratulated us on a great deal. The room was excellent, very clean and neat. Upkeep was excellent and nothing was missing or out of place. The room was made up each day without a hitch. We ate in the hotels restaurant 3 times (1 breakfast and 2 dinner) and loved each meal. Dinner prices are reflective of the class of hotel. Would stay here again in a heartbeat. I am not sure where some of the reviewers who posted earlier stayed, but I cannot believe it was the hotel we stayed at.

Reviews.Title: “Not up to par with the others”
Reviews.Author: hawkeye_2000
Reviews.Content: When we arrived at our room (1023) on October 22, the bed was made, but the linen from the previous guest was still there (hence dirty bedding). The House keeping did change the bed. The next day we chose to eat breakfast 8:30 at the Hot Tuna, we stood for ten minutes before we were greeted and shown to a table. There was only one guest before us an the hostess was visiting with a personal friend. We ask to sit next to the window, she said it was reserved. We were seated to to the door to the kitchen area and waited for additional 15 minutes, we were not offered coffee, water nor even a menu. during rhe 25 minutes the window table remained vacant. I finally got up and looked at the breakfast buffet, the eggs appeared to be old, the bacon and sausage "cold" and unappetizing. I returned to the table and asked my wife if we have coffee yet. No we waited for a few more minutes an then left. One should not have to wait for 20 minutes on non service. The majority of the dining area did not have customers. We did not attempt another meal at the Omni. After going across the street for breakfast (Another hotel, sorry to say). We approach the information desk for information about what to do by the desk attendent and if he had information about shows on the Theater strip. I do confess, I did interupt his email checking and web surfing. He gave us a booklet that was in are room. He didn't have clue, other there is a game on Sunday! Great if you are leaving on saturday. The room was ok, could have used a vacuuming, and the bed spread needed to be laundered as well. The hall from the Omni to the Nordstrom sky walk is loose and worn. Not very impressive, and looks like some ones hall to the garage. The valet service was courteous, well mannered, and offered more help than the reception desk, the information desk and the definetly the restuarant. I am disappointed in the four star service ranking. My previous exposure to Omni was in Atlanta, and then I thought I am going to stay here next time. We were disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant Surprise”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I had to come to Indianapolis for a family function and wanted to stay on the north side of the city so I decided to stay at the Omni North Hotel. I was very happy with my speed of check in and the front desk staff was very polite. I did not know the area very well but the staff was more than helpful giving me suggestions on shopping and restaurants in the area. They even provided me with printed directions to these areas and asked if I would like directions to my family member's house were the function was being held. I thought this was very unique since most places assume you know where you are going when dealing with family events. I had never been here before and their service helped me greatly especially since my parents had given me the wrong directions. Thank you Omni staff and I will see you again when I return to Indy.

Reviews.Title: “Omni Indianapolis North”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I'm not sure which Omni in Indianapolis the other reviewers were speaking about but, I stayed at the Omni Indianapolis North for a wedding and reception and had a wonderful time. The service was great and the food on the prime rib buffet in abruzzis restaurant was fabulous. I highly recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Never again!”
Reviews.Author: RosemaryBurton
Reviews.Content: Where to begin....we used an online discount chain to book the room and asked for a four star hotel. We were very unhappy with the front desk when we called to make sure that we would have two double beds instead of one king size as we would be bringing our children. They would not help us at all! If we could have changed out minds at this point we would have but we had gone online and didn't have a refund option. We arrived late and were met at the locked doors after about 10 minutes of waiting. We were so exhausted that we didn't really look at the room we just fell asleep. We didn't sleep well because the bedding was cheap and rough and the bed- spread was made out of some plastic like material that was very loud. In the morning we found that the furniture was broken, the sway to the beds left us all with a back ache. The quality of everything was worse than any budget motel I have ever stayed at! There was new carpeting through out the hotel but that was all that was new. The room was full of disrepair and out of date items. I was very disappointed and started to not feel very well to top it all off. We were riding down the elevator when someone who was working for the company asked if we were enjoying our stay. My brother in-law who had come to join us for lunch while my husband was at his convention spoke up and told her that our stay had not exactly met our expectations. She immediately had us moved to a nicer room. The front desk was VERY unhappy about the switch of rooms and his every action said so. The staff overall was flip, condescending and acted like they were above meeting the needs of the guests. The new room was in better repair but the quality problem didn't go away! The toilet paper reminded me of our trip to Russia. It was just above brown paper towels. There was a huge problem with cleanliness. The first room suffered from long periods of hit an miss cleaning while the second room with it's newer tiles was just getting started with nice fresh problems. There was hair in the bathtub from the previous occupants. The tub itself was cheap and still had old fixtures that should have been replaced in the remodeling. The windows were filthy. There was broken glass after the room had been cleaned and they just left the smaller pieces in the door way of the bathroom. I found one with my bare feet and cleaned up what I could before the kids came back form the pool. Lets just say that we paid a fair price for room that wouldn't live up to a roadside flop house. The outside and the lobby were very deceptive of the rooms quality and service and I would have left if I could have gotten my money back and most certainly would have left anyway if our stay was not so short. I did become ill and needed to find medical attention. The staff was not very helpful but finally very rudely said that we should try an emergency medical center right behind the hotel. Everything was so bad that our teenaged son who is normally and just due to age clueless to anything like cleanliness of a hotel room (just point him to the pool) asked as we rode down the elevator to find the med center if we had to stay in this place? While we were out a friend called but they would not take a message and there was no answering system. They said they wouldn't get anything done if they took messages for guests. I told them it didn't look like it was helping much.

Reviews.Title: “Not Nearly Meeting the Standard”
Reviews.Author: TravelerKD
Reviews.Content: What made the situation more acceptable was getting a low conference rate. But attention to details is lacking. The hotel's climate is erratic. The lobby is exasperatingly hot, while some conference rooms are chilly. There were mysterious problems with our reservations, which had to be ironed out at the front desk with undue frustration. Expect to pay unreasonable parking fees if you stay here. The standard room rate is an absolute ripoff. If you get a very low rate (i.e. conference rate of $87.00) it may be okay, but not a good deal.

Reviews.Title: “Not in sync with other Omni Hotels”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We are Select Guest with the Omni, and we stay at Omni's all over the country. This Omni was like a discount Omni. The rooms were big, but they did not offer most of the amenities the other hotels do... nor were they polite when asked. In fact, the woman at the front desk was as rude as she could be, and there were staff sleeping in the lobby when we came in at midnight! We put our drink order on the door for the next morning...and it never came. They called us 1 hour early for our wake up call. The maid claims we had a Do Not Disturb on our door - and that is why our room was not cleaned one day - yet we NEVER use the Do Not Disturb sign. The hotel is clean and the rooms are large, but that is the only good thing I can say about this Omni. I would not stay there again.
